definition.config: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="config_start" deletable="false" x="40" y="40"><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">disable_message</field><field name="comment">If true, hides that annoying text wall whenever you join a game. Does not affect error reports.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Disable Join Message</field><field name="value">false</field></block></value><next><block type="config_category"><field name="name">General Radiation Options</field><statement name="write"><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">old_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether to use the old radiation system exclusively. This may be required for mods made for 1.x.x, but may break mods for 2.x.x. Also required for datapacks, unless the newer V3 is used..</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Use Old Radiation System</field><field name="value">false</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">radiation_multiplier</field><field name="comment">The amount of radiation received will be multiplied by this number. This will not show up in tooltips. Use 0 to disable all radiation.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Radiation Multiplier</field><field name="value">1</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">decon_multiplier</field><field name="comment">The amount of radiation removed by DamageSource will be multiplied by this number. Use 0 to disable all radiation.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Decontamination Multiplier</field><field name="value">1</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">radiation_poisoning_scaling</field><field name="comment">Smaller number here => faster radiation effect progression => harder game. Use at the risk of your sanity and friendships.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Radiation Effects Scaling</field><field name="value">100</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">radiation_sickness_scaling</field><field name="comment">Smaller number => slower damage increase from Radiation Sickness. Default 1.5.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Radiation Sickness Scaling</field><field name="value">1.5</field></block></value></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></statement><next><block type="config_category"><field name="name">Old Radiation System</field><statement name="write"><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">inventory_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow radioactive items to affect a player holding them</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Inventory Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">proximity_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow entities to irradiate others by holding something radioactive nearby</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Proximity Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">entity_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow entities to irradiate others by existing nearby</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Entity Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">block_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow blocks to irradiate entities near them</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Block Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">weapon_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow weapons to irradiate hit entities</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Weapon Hit Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">blockrad_range</field><field name="comment">Range (in blocks) that blocks irradiate things from</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Block Radiation Range</field><field name="value">16</field></block></value></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></statement><next><block type="config_category"><field name="name">New Radiation System</field><statement name="write"><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">irradiation_damage</field><field name="comment">If false, all 'Irradiate' damage types will become normal damage types, but without the damage cooldown (unless the previous option is ticked)</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Irradiate Damage Types</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">decontamination_damage</field><field name="comment">As with the previous option, but for the 'Decontamination' damage types.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Decontaminate Damage Types</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">resists_decon</field><field name="comment">If true, radiation resistance will be applied to decontamination damage as well.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Rad-Resistance Affects Decontamination</field><field name="value">false</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">only_player_radiation</field><field name="comment">If true, radiation will be applied only to players, and will use a synced data tag to store radiation. If false, NBT tags will be used instead.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Irradiate Only Players</field><field name="value">false</field></block></value><next><block type="config_category"><field name="name">v3</field><statement name="write"><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to use version 3 radiation, a more performant version of the Old Radiation System. Does not require Old Radiation System to be enabled.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Use V3 Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_inventory_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow radioactive items to affect a player holding them. This IS separate to the one in the 'Old Radiation System' area.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Inventory Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_inventory_radiation_definition</field><field name="comment">A list of item registry names to make radioactive. Should be in the form <mod>:<item_id>=<rads_per_tick>, e.g. minecraft:dirt=2 makes dirt radioactive, giving 40 RADs per second.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Inventory Radiation Definition</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test=1</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_proximity_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow entities to irradiate others by holding something radioactive nearby. This IS separate to the one in the 'Old Radiation System' area.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Proximity Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_proximity_radiation_definition</field><field name="comment">Like Inventory Radiation Definition, but with an extra part, range. Range should be specified after amount, separated by a ~, e.g. minecraft:dirt=2~4 makes dirt give 40 RADs per second to all entities (unless 'Irradiate Only Players' is enabled) within 4 blocks.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Proximity Radiation Definition</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test=1~4</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_block_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow blocks to irradiate entities near them. This IS separate to the one in the 'Old Radiation System' area.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Block Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_block_radiation_definition</field><field name="comment">Like Proximity Radiation Definition, but for blocks.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Block Radiation Definition</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test_block=1~4</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_biome_radiation</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow biomes to irradiate entities in them.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Biome Radiation</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_biome_radiation_definition</field><field name="comment">A list of biome registry names to make radioactive, in the form id=amount per tick</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Biome Radiation Definition</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test_biome=4</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_cures</field><field name="comment">Whether or not to allow biomes to irradiate entities in them.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_logic_variable"><field name="name">Enable Curative Items</field><field name="value">true</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_cure_definition</field><field name="comment">A list of item ids, with the amount of radiation they remove, in the form <item>=<absolute cure> or <item>=<percentage cure>%</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Curative Item Definition</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test_cure=400","radioactive:test_cure_2=30%</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_auto_cure</field><field name="comment">A list of cures which will use themselves up when their animation finishes.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Force-Depleting Cure List</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test_cure</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_speed_cure</field><field name="comment">A list of cures which will have no animation, but are usable anyway.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Fast Cure List</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test_cure_2</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_radiation_resistance_definition</field><field name="comment">Defines rad-resistance of armor items. Form: <mod>:<id>=<percentage>, e.g.  minecraft:iron_helmet=10 gives an iron helmet 10% rad-resistance, and bloons:bloon_lead_helmet=25 gives a Bloon Lead Helmet (from the Bloons Mod) 25% radiation resistance.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Radiation Resistance Definition</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:test_prot_helmet=10","radioactive:test_prot_chestplate=20","radioactive:test_prot_leggings=15","radioactive:test_prot_boots=10</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_counter_definition</field><field name="comment">Defines a list of radiation counter items. Each entry should be a single registry name.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Counter List</field><field name="entry0">radioactive:counter</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_detector_definition</field><field name="comment">Defines a list of radiation detector items.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Detector List</field><field name="entry0"> </field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">v3_radimmunity</field><field name="comment">A list of entities that should not receive radiation damage, or effects. Can still be irradiated, but won't feel it at all.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_textlist_variable"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="name">Immune Entities</field><field name="entry0"> </field></block></value></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></statement></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></statement><next><block type="config_category"><field name="name">Radiation Resistance</field><statement name="write"><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">base_resistance</field><field name="comment">Percentage rad-resistance the player has without armor. Range: 0-100, default 0</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Base Player Radiation Resistance</field><field name="value">0</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">max_resistance</field><field name="comment">Highest percentage rad-resistance a player can have. May be helpful on servers to keep radiation dangerous. Range 0-100, default 100.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Maximum Radiation Resistance</field><field name="value">100</field></block></value><next><block type="config_variable"><field name="name">resistance_multiplier</field><field name="comment">Radiation resistance will be multiplied by this number before being applied to radiation. Default 1.</field><value name="value"><block type="config_number_variable"><field name="name">Radiation Resistance Multiplier</field><field name="value">1</field></block></value></block></next></block></next></block></statement></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
